Posted By: androkguz (5/17/2010 3:35:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I agree with the prior comments from Guest and Zulp.  
New artworks are something we're familiar with in Core Sets (or reprints in general), yet it's kind of strange having a completely different artwork for a legend which depicts a very specific being.  
I like it, but i think they should at least have made a very similar one.  
Even [green Kamahl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=40538) for instance has a strong resemblance to the [red one](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=29963) - which on top of that kept his appearance as opposed to Laquatus in his new [Tenth Edition artwork](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=106398).
posts.html:
I agree with the prior comments from Guest and Zulp.
New artworks are something we're familiar with in Core Sets (or reprints in general), yet it's kind of strange having a completely different artwork for a legend which depicts a very specific being.
I like it, but i think they should at least have made a very similar one.
Even green Kamahl for instance has a strong resemblance to the red one - which on top of that kept his appearance as opposed to Laquatus in his new Tenth Edition artwork.

I have a merfolk mill deck that is just built for him. A pity he's not useful for anything else
